result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin (nmi) Rzentkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs of the action have been paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin (nmi) Rzentkowski

defendant.name: Rzentkowski, Martin (nmi)

records.addlTxt: to Defendant, check no. 10746
E-mail between Clerk/State/Defense re: amount due

Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that completion information has been provided to State. State advises of receipt of proof of completion, moves to amend count 1 to Door County ordinance. Defense enters guilty plea on Defendant's behalf. Court finds Defendant guilty, imposes costs.

Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court. Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises that very little has been received from Defendant, requests another date to get proof that conditions have been completed. Defense advises that Defendant has completed nearly all requirements, didn't understand that he needed to provide proof.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for January 22, 2018 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

ADDRESS INFO for Martin (nmi) Rzentkowski
Current: 12648 North River Forest Circle, Mequon, WI 53092 United States  (Effective: 04-27-2017)
Prior: 124 West Falls Road, Grafton, WI 53024 United States
Defendant appeared voluntarily.

Defendant Martin (nmi) Rzentkowski in court with attorney Matthew J Pribyl.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State advises of discussions with Defense, requests that warrant be quashed, will extend DAPGA for 6 months to allow Defendant time to comply with terms of agreement. Defense agrees, makes statement regarding Defendant's status. Discussion regarding conditions that need to be completed. Court questions Defendant, who understands necessity and benefits of completing conditions. Discussion regarding whether 6 months is long enough. Case can be resolved by written stipulation if proof of compliance has been provided to State. State requests cash bond, which would then be applied to financial obligations. Defense advises that Defendant can pay today.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for January 8, 2018 at 08:45 am.

Prior: P.O. Box 384, 10226 Woodcrest Road, Sister Bay, WI 54234

Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense does not know why Defendant isn't present, advises of contact with and attempts to contact Defendant. Court reviews State's Motion to Vacate DAGPA. State requests bench warrant. Defense requests 24 hours to contact Defendant. Court denies request, issues bench warrant.
Motion hearing on April 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
to vacate DAGPA

Attorney Matthew J Pribyl in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. State advises that this was to be the sentencing, but Defendant has not complied with any conditions of the Deferred, will be preparing motion to vacate the agreement. Defense advises of correspondence sent to Defendant advising of deadlines, advises of e-mail received at 3:00 a.m. about today's court date. Court will schedule hearing upon receipt of motion.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on March 27, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
$50 plus costs if amended to ordinance = $267.50
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Martin (nmi) Rzentkowski in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of DAGPA. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, withholds acceptance of plea, reviews conditions contained within DAGPA, accepts DAGPA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 20, 2017 at 04:00 pm.
by Defendant
to Appear
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Martin Rzentkowski in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
